page.title: 05ROADS PATHS STREAMS LAND
page.content: {ROADS }THE MAJOR ROAD IN THE AREA IS THE A515.THIS IS A METALLED ROAD THAT TRAVERSES THE NORTH EAST SECTION, RUNNING NORTH TO SOUTH.THERE ARE MINOR METALLED IN MOST OF THE AREA APART FROM THE SOUTH WEST. {FOOTPATHS}APART FROM THE WEST,THERE ARE SEVERAL PATHS WHICH TEND TO LINK THE FARMS. {WATERWAYS}THERE ARE THREE STREAMS IN THE REGION OF BOYLESTONE,NONE OF WHICH ARE MAJOR AND NONE OF WHICH ARE NAVIGABLE.TWO OF THESE JOIN TO MAKE FOSTON BROOK,THE THIRD IS CALLED DALE BROOK AND THEY ALL FLOW SOUTH INTO THE RIVER DOVE. {LAND }THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE REGION IS IN THE NORTH WEST NEAR COTON WOOD FARM,SPOTHEIGHT 131.THE LOWEST POINT IS IN THE SOUTH EAST NEAR BROOMHILL, SPOT HEIGHT 73.THE LAND SLOPES GRADUALLY FROM THE NORTH WEST TO THE
